de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.parser
Class ParserImpl

java.lang.Object
  de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.parser.ParserImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IParser
Direct Known Subclasses:
TMQLParser, TMQLParser
public abstract class ParserImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IParser

Base implementation of IParser. The parser transform the string-represented and language-specific token lists to a tree-representation by interpreting the current TMQL draft. The generated parsing tree representing the structure of the given query split by productions rules.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Method Detail

getParserTree

public IParserTree getParserTree()
Method return the result of parsing process. The result will be a tree-structured representation of the origin query. Each node of the tree represents a independent production rule.

Specified by:
getParserTree in interface IParser
Returns:
a parser tree instance

parse

public void parse(ITMQLRuntime runtime)
           throws TMQLParserException
Method starts the internal parsing process to transform the string-represented and language-specific token lists to a tree-representation by interpreting the current TMQL draft. The generated parsing tree representing the structure of the given query split by productions rules.

Specified by:
parse in interface IParser
Parameters:
runtime - the TMQL runtime
Throws:
TMQLParserException - thrown if the generation of the parsing tree fails

getParserTreeInstance

protected abstract ParserTreeImpl getParserTreeInstance(ITMQLRuntime runtime,
                                                        IQuery query,
                                                        ILexer lexer)
Method returns the parser tree instance used to generate the parser tree

Parameters:
runtime - the runtime
query - the query
lexer - the lexical scanner
Returns:
the parser tree instance and never null

isValid

private boolean isValid(ITMQLRuntime runtime,
                        IQuery query)
                 throws TMQLParserException
Method checks if the parser tree is valid. The parser tree is valid, if the parser tree contains on top-level only expressions which are allowed.

Parameters:
runtime - the TMQL4J runtime
Returns:
true if the parser tree is valid, false otherwise.
Throws:
TMQLParserException
